comment: Professor was chill, Easy class as long as you participated and did assignments. However, he was often unorganized and did not know what was going on half the time. Despite this, he was fine.
I enjoyed taking his class. Inside and outside the class he is nice. He is very helpful if you need anything answered or if you need clarification.

takes long to get email back. lots of projects but they are all completion grade tbh. quizzes and tests are a little difficult/don't make sense but they aren't lockdown. Didn't do well on my quizzes and did all my projects and passed w a 93. there is a group project but it's much easier than you expect, think high school PowerPoint. PUT IN EFFORT.

I don't understand how people get the impression that he cares about his student. He is rude, disrespectful and, despite opening claims, not actually open to discussion. He is unorganized and clearly winging every class. He doesn't teach the content despite mandatory attendance. We did not discuss one quiz topic in class. Easy A, but horrible.
good professor, had a group to work with for a few assignments. Pretty chill class just do the work on time and you will be just fine!

Took this class online and the communication on how to complete assignments/projects is awful. He only has instructions in the syllabus that barely makes sense. Included links that arent even active! I had to contact support for one of the projects and they didnt even know what to tell me. Sucks online, could be good in person idk. Good luck.

A lot of class was just debating topics not lecure heavy at all. Everything is through connect including tests (not lockdown). Lots of connect quizzes. There is a group project that was pretty easy as well as the excel and other projects were all done in class and he walked you through it. Grades pretty easy and is very laid back.Would take again.

He definitely wrote some of these reviews himself. Dr. Nick is a bad professor it's that simple. He puts down students and their ideas for his own enjoyment. Do not let him put you down, just grit your teeth and make it through his class and never look back.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: Down right horrible prof

Ended up being a stupidly easy class, even the major projects seemed to be graded by completion. Good luck getting him to respond to an email though. Just do well on every assignment on McGraw that has points attached to it and theres no way you'll get below an A
Great Professor, highly recommended!!!! TAKE PROFESSOR SUPPIAH!!!!
Avoid this professor at all costs, seriously.

I genuinely feel Dr. Nick is lost and has no idea what he is doing. The grades are all over the place and the communication is not the best either. I wish he was more organized. If you will take this course online just be aware you will be having a lot of panic attacks because the grades will be 0s out of nowhere even if you did the work.

Assigned a 10 page paper for an 8 week online course, and gave the prompt for the paper a week and a half before it was due. Also assigned a 13 page group project paper with little to no directions. It it clear that teaching is his side job because he clearly does not bother spending any time to explain the material. Extremely unorganized as well.

Dr. Suppiah was a great professor. He condensed the coursework to make it more efficient. I genuinely learned a lot from his class and he made it enjoyable. One group project (presentation and essay), one individual essay, 2 case studies, and 1-2 quizzes per week. 10/10 -> take his class!!!
I took him for IS 3220, IS Project Management. Do the work, and you'll make an A. Not hard at all
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment:
He's a great teacher, really cares about his students. He tries to help in any way he can. 1 group project that wasn't too bad. 10 page paper !!
Attendance is mandatory.

Has a very nice college feel approach to teaching. Sure there are some curricular stuff ,but he mostly focuses in bring an understanding of real-life application. Talking about what to expect in this field and recent innovations. I was taking 6 classes and was happy to have had this as a easier but still impactful class.

Overall this class is a confusing waste of time, everything is based on a real project he is working on, but he overcomplicates everything and gets mad at students when they don't understand.
Choices for this class are few but if you can find another prof, I would take them.

Dr Nick pretends to care, he doesn't. All of his class is based on his job, and he just talks about the drama there, instead of teaching. He bullies students, calls them out and makes fun of them. His assignments are unclear, and not always posted on D2L.
He is funny sometimes, but overall I do not recommend this class.

Class wasn't hard at all. Only grades were simulation assignments for Microsoft Excel and Access graded on completion, a couple simple case studies, a midterm and final that were both open note, and a 10-page paper that's not hard as long as you don't procrastinate. Very self-paced class.

This class is super weird & confusing, the teacher doesn't teach you a single thing. You will take these Excel assessments & final assessments to grade u on the materials you've "learned" in class, Mr.Suppiah was weird w/ his due dates but he was also super flexible & changed the dates whenever we came together as a class & asked for an extension.

No idea how he has such high ratings. Everything was extremely confusing, due dates, what was due, etc. Required final paper and assignments due during a vacation break, left us with two weeks to do one last assignment, and absolutely ridiculous deadlines. Doesn't teach, does this part-time, zero study materials or test guidance. Just awful!

Dr. Suppiah is one of the best professors I have ever had. He is a professor because he wants to be. He believes in helping other students and cares about their success. He gives his students an opportunity to connect with anytime, and usually gives great advice whether it be about school or life. He explains everything thoroughly and concisely.
Absolutely amazing professor.

His take on IS is unlike any other. There is a learning curve for the first week as you get used to his conversational lecture style but once you get the hang of it its very easy. There is an excel assignment and final group project, both have a decent amount of work involved, however I think he just gives you a 100 if you complete it.

If I could take every class through him, I would. His take on IS is very unique, but I feel like I've learned more in this class, than any other one I've taken at KSU. He is very well respected, and as long as you show up to class (attendance is mandatory for good reason) and do the work, you'll excel (lol) in this class and have a blast. TAKE HIM!

Dr. Nick really cares about his students. He literally gave out his number for us to text him with any questions. He's hilarious too.  Grade was made up by some assignments and quizzes, a midterm and final (no lockdown), and 1 big group project you have to present in suit & tie. If you actually want to learn about IS though, don't do his class.
most boring lectures ever but the best professor for this class. really cares ab his students
Great Professor that gives us real world insight in his lessons and lectures. Classes were always engaging, and it was very clear on what to do and how to do it. Take him if you can!

He uses his classes to depress his students and gives us his most pessimistic view of the world. He seems like a genuinely happy guy, but I go to the mandatory class sessions and always leave somewhat sadder. He discusses AI and ethics. Class content itself is easy and he gives the least busy work. Make friends in class to help with Excel.

Dr. Nick is a great professor. He talks a lot about real world things and doesn't really lecture about the material. So if you are someone interested in IS and want to get a feel for it, I don't suggest him. If you want a pretty easy A and a fun hour of discussion most classes each week, he is your guy.
I would take his class again if I could. He really understood students and even helped to create opportunities for participating students. A+!

Dr Nick is my favorite professor and I'm not even an IS major. He takes a real-world approach to his lectures and really makes an effort to know you. If you're good about attending class (he's understanding about emergencies) and do the bonus discussions then you'll do fine in his class. He has a lot of connections, definitely recommend taking him!
Dr. Nick is one the best professor in ksu. He explain all of the assignments in class. He understanding, the his to answer the question, and answer his email quickly. I highly recommended him.

DR nick is so underrated he is phenomenal, he is very understanding and caring especially when it comes to helping his students, he will do anything to help you in his class as long as you do your work and you attend class, he tries to teach his students tricks and knowledge that could be used in real life, i definitely recommend him.

Great professor! He really cares about his students, and makes a huge effort to engage with them. He's very big on bringing real world business knowledge and experience into his lectures, which I found really interesting and helpful. Highly recommend!

Honestly one of the best professors I've ever had. He really cares about his students. He's big on bringing "real world" knowledge and experience into his lectures, and loves class discussions. He grades really easy, not a hard class at all. But despite that, I probably learned more from Dr. Nick than any other professor in the business program.
Cares about his students a lot you guys won't have a hard time with him. Easy grader and will take the time out of his day to reach out and help.

Nick Suppiah is a great professor. His lectures are not relevant to his quizzes or exams so read the book. His group project and case study papers are really easy. For the projects he does read the peer reviews so be honest. He genuinely cares for his students and tries to help his students to have a great resume and find an internship.

Suppiah may not be the best teacher, but he really does help you succeed in his course as long as you make an effort. His lectures aren't very entertaining or even important to your test taking, but go to class because he walks you through projects step by step. Assessments are straight from the books, I used Quizlet a lot for them too. He's cool!

Doc Nick was a really good teacher and interesting to listen to if you're interested in technology. I found a few of his assignments to be challenging and time consuming. Lots of easy quizzes. Group project was a good bit of work, but he's an easy grader. I really liked this teacher even though I really hated the class. Take him!

At first I did not like him because of how he ran his class. As I kept going through the semester I liked his teaching style more and more. He knows that everyone in his class is capable of getting an A, the students just have to want it. Extremely easy grader and is willing to help all students.

Took his IS 2200 class and am currently taking IS 3100 with him. His lectures may not be the most entertaining but hes very knowledgeable and notices effort. If you participate in class and just listen, youll get a good grade.

Never responded to emails, and did not grade any projects for over two months. We had a different project to do every week, with little to no instructions given. On week 1 we had a coding assignment due. There was an assignment that Mac users couldn't do so we had to write a 10 page paper instead. Very easy grader & quizzes/test are no lockdown.
Horrible Professor. Unresponsive

He was nice and knew a lot about the business world. The lectures, while interesting, were irrelevant to the class. The online quizzes are from the book and are fairly easy. There are many projects which aren't necessarily hard, but he does not explain them well, and didn't seem to know how to do some himself. Didn't respond to email for a week+.

A nice guy but that's about it. His lectures are dry as he just reads straight off the powerpoint. Occasionally he talks about interesting things but they have little to do with the projects or quizzes. Projects VERY CONFUSING. He could not even explain them, but leniently graded them. He says only get one textbook, but get both bc quizzes on both

Easily the worst professor I've ever had at KSU. Never answered a single email this semester (I've sent 6). Gave us a coding project without teaching us anything about coding and then cancelled the assignment 3 hours before it was due. Gave us 2 weeks for an excel project, but really only got 4 days bc he uploaded the wrong one. DO NOT TAKE!!

He's an amazing professor. Going to class counts in your favor. Will be considerate if he sees your effort. Lectures aren't that helpful. Weekly quizzes straight from textbook, midterm, and final. Weekly assignments and huge group project towards the end of the semester. Will try to help you in any way as long as you show that you need help. Take!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: This class definitely is not as hard as everyone makes it out to be. This course as a whole is hard. The assignments are a little confusing at first, but for the most part he is very receptive to helping you understand. Very nice guy and would love to take him again given the opportunity.

This teacher doesn't grade in a timely manner so good luck knowing how you're doing. If he sets up group phone calls, you can expect him to reschedule. He grades really easily (not even sure he pays attention to the work). Instead of uplifting students, he shames them saying they should be able to do x and y because he can. He frustrates students.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Group projects
